Description: Body sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery Siana or little-master cup; interior: band of alternate red and black tongues with two lines at their base; exterior glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 51)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 422, no. B663)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1331) (phase 3)
